Package compiler

Class SML_Compiler

java.lang.Object
compiler.SML_Compiler
public class SML_Compiler extends Object
A Compiler for the high-level language. It defines the static method compile(requirement.util.Requirements) which generates machine code instructions for a high-level language program. The Compiler is stateless meaning that no information is stored between compilations and that an instance of a Compiler is not necessary to compile a program. Each call to compile creates a new Compiler instance therefore there aren't any synchronisation issues.

The compilation uses Requirements in order to specify different parameters. They can be obtained with the getRequirements() method, which contains more information about each individual Requirement.

Author:
Alex Mandelias

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(String[] args)
      Uses the command line arguments to specify the parameters necessary to compile a high-level-language program, and then compiles it. Parameters starting with a single dash '-' are set to true. Parameters starting with a double dash '--' are set to whatever the next argument is.

      The different parameters are documented in the getRequirements() method.

      Parameters:
      args - the command line arguments

    • getRequirements

      public static requirement.util.Requirements getRequirements()
      Returns the Requirements needed for compilation. They have their default values and can be used as-is for compilation. 
       | Value   | Default | Explanation          | Command Line |
 |---------|---------|----------------------|--------------|
 | input   | stdin   | "stdin" or filename  | --           |
 | output  | out.sml | "stdout" or filename | --           |
 | screen  | false   | output to stdout too | -            |
 | st      | false   | output SymbolTable   | -            |
 | verbose | false   | output all messages  | -            |
      Returns:
      the Requirements

    • streams

      public static StreamSet streams()
      Returns a StreamSet that can be passed as a parameter to construct a Compiler. The StreamSet can be configured with different input, output and error Streams for the Compiler to use instead of the "standard" in, out and err Streams of the System class.
      Returns:
      the StreamSet
      See Also:
      StreamSet

    • compile

      public void compile​(requirement.util.Requirements requirements)
      Uses the parameters from the requirements in order to load the program, compile it and output the results.

      The different Requirements are documented in the getRequirements() method.

      Parameters:
      requirements - the parameters needed to compile

      Returns:

      Returns:

    • declareVariable

      int declareVariable​(String symbol, String varType)
      Declares a variable of a specific varType for a symbol by allocating an address for it in memory and creating an Entry in the Symbol Table.
      Parameters:
      symbol - the variable's symbol
      varType - the variable's varType (int, string etc.)
      Returns:
      the location of the declared variable in memory

    • declareConstant

      int declareConstant​(String symbol, String varType)
      Declares a constant of a specific varType for a symbol by storing it an address for it in memory and creating an Entry in the Symbol Table.
      Parameters:
      symbol - the constant's symbol
      varType - the constant's varType (int, string etc.)
      Returns:
      the location of the declared constant in memory

    • declareLabel

      int declareLabel​(String symbol)
      Declares a label by creating an Entry in the Symbol Table.
      Parameters:
      symbol - the label's symbol
      Returns:
      the location of the declared label in memory, the location of the first instruction corresponding to this label

    • getSymbolTable

      SymbolTable getSymbolTable()
      Returns the SymbolTable that the compiler uses to keep track of the different symbols found in the high-level program.
      Returns:
      the Symbol Table

    • setBranchLocation

      void setBranchLocation​(int location, int address)
      Sets the address in memory where the a branch instruction will jump to. The instruction is located at the location in memory.
      Parameters:
      location - the address of the instruction
      address - the address to jump

    • setLabelToJump

      void setLabelToJump​(int location, String labelToJump)
      Sets the label in the high-level-program where the a branch instruction will jump to. The instruction is located at the location in memory. This method does NOT complete the actual branch instruction. It acts merely marks the label so that later, when the address of that label in the machine code is known, the branch instruction can be completed.
      Parameters:
      location - the address of the instruction.
      labelToJump - the label to jump

    • pushBlock

      void pushBlock​(Block block)
      Pushes a new Block to the stack.
      Parameters:
      block - the block

    • popBlock

      Block popBlock()
      Retrieves the most recently added Block from the stack.
      Returns:
      the block
      Throws:
      EmptyStackException - if the stack of Blocks is empty
